SEARCH
Module pipeline
Package tcpassos.pipeline

Interface AsyncPipeline<BEGIN,END>

Type Parameters:
BEGIN - the type of the input to the pipeline
END - the type of the output from the pipeline
All Superinterfaces:
BasePipeline<BEGIN,CompletableFuture<END>>
public interface AsyncPipeline<BEGIN,END> extends BasePipeline<BEGIN,CompletableFuture<END>>
Represents an asynchronous pipeline that transforms an input of type BEGIN to an output of type END. The pipeline operates on CompletableFuture objects, allowing for asynchronous execution.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static interface 
    AsyncPipeline.Branched<BEGIN,END>
    Represents a branched asynchronous pipeline in the Java Pipeline API.

      static <BEGIN, END> AsyncPipeline<BEGIN,END> of(BasePipeline<BEGIN,Optional<END>> pipeline)
      Creates an asynchronous pipeline from a base pipeline.
      Type Parameters:
      BEGIN - the type of the input to the pipeline
      END - the type of the output from the pipeline
      Parameters:
      pipeline - the base pipeline to convert to an asynchronous pipeline
      Returns:
      an asynchronous pipeline

    • connect

      default <NEW_END> AsyncPipeline<BEGIN,NEW_END> connect(BasePipeline<END,Optional<NEW_END>> next)
      Connects the current pipeline to the given next pipeline.
      Type Parameters:
      NEW_END - the new end type of the pipeline
      Parameters:
      next - the next pipeline to connect to
      Returns:
      a new asynchronous pipeline that represents the connection between the current pipeline and the next pipeline

    • connect

      default <NEW_END> AsyncPipeline<BEGIN,NEW_END> connect(AsyncPipeline<END,NEW_END> next)
      Connects the current pipeline to the given pipeline, creating a new pipeline that executes the current pipeline followed by the given pipeline.
      Type Parameters:
      NEW_END - the new end type of the resulting pipeline
      Parameters:
      next - the pipeline to connect to the current pipeline
      Returns:
      a new pipeline that executes the current pipeline followed by the given pipeline

    • connect

      default <NEW_END> AsyncPipeline.Branched<BEGIN,NEW_END> connect(Collection<AsyncPipeline<END,NEW_END>> next)
      Connects the current pipeline to a collection of next pipelines, creating a branched pipeline. This method returns a new instance of the `Branched` interface, which represents the branched pipeline.
      Type Parameters:
      NEW_END - the type of the end result of the next pipelines
      Parameters:
      next - the collection of next pipelines to connect to
      Returns:
      a new instance of the `Branched` interface representing the branched pipeline
